alert.note: Alert for Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 7:12PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Iron County through 745 PM CDT... At 711 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Turtle Flambeau Flowage, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mercer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Wisconsin.
